answers.answer: I've gotten about 5 or 6 and will have 7 total, but I think I had so many at the beginning due to a thyroid issue. My friends all have gotten more like 3 or 4.
It is usually common to only get 2 maybe 3 usually the fist one is to see how far along you are then the gender revel and up to your doctor if you get one later. I would ask your doctor.
I have had 1 per pregnancy at 20 weeks
I am not getting one at all
I got two. I'm so glad my Dr. Puts them on DVD. Something I will always be able to watch and show my child when she gets older.
I get one at every appointment. My doctors office has an ultrasound machine in our exam rooms. But typically I believe its normal to have 2-3.
A normal pregnancy needs no more than 2, but I've got more than 10 in this pregnancy due to high risk.

I honestly lost track,due to the fact that the baby's heart rate is low my doctor does an ultra sound sometimes 1 or 2ce a week to ensure she is stable. (I'm 34 weeks and geting a C section at 39 weeks)
I've had 2 so far, looking foward to my 3rd and final one :(

I had the two routine scans (at 12 and 20 weeks) plus an extra at 7 weeks due to a significant history of miscarriage. I found out yesterday I will be getting a fourth at 35 weeks due to a diagnosis of gestational diabetes that requires closer monitoring. Low risk pregnancies, as stated upthread, generally don't warrant more than one or two scans.

It depends on your dr, insurance, and where you live. My sister doesn't have really good insurance so she had three I've had 5 and I have one or two more to go my dr will do as many 3d ultrasounds you want

question: How many ultrasounds so you usually get throughout your pregnancy?
title: ultrasounds?
